provisions.title: Section 1
provisions.content:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Agricultural Marketing
Regulations, 1945.

provisions.title: Section 2
provisions.content:
2. For the purposes of these Regulations “Registrar” means the
Marketing Administrator.

provisions.title: Section 3
provisions.content:
3. The Registrar shall keep a register of producers of specified
articles in the form set forth as Form 1 in the Schedule.          Form 1.

provisions.title: Section 4
provisions.content:
4. Every producer of an article which has been declared by the
Minister to be a specified article shall as soon as may be practicable after
the date of such declaration make application to the Registrar in the
form set forth as Form 2 in the Schedule to be registered as a producer ~ - 2 .
of such specified article.

provisions.title: Section 5
provisions.content:
5. Every applicant for registration shall in his appl‘ication specify-
    (1) the quantity of the specified article produced by him during the
        twelve months immediately preceding the date on which such
        article was declared to be specified;
    (2) the price for which he sold such specified article during the
        period of twelve months aforesaid; and
    (3) the channels through which he sold such specified artick during
        the said period of twehe months.

provisions.title: Section 6
provisions.content:
6.41) Where the Registrar is not satisfied with the information given
in any application he shall by notice in writing require the applicant to
furnish him with such further and better particulars concerning the
matter required to be set out in the application as he m a y require. Every
such notice may be posted to the applicant to the address stated in the
application.

                (2) On the receipt of any such notice the applicant shall forthwith
          supply the Registrar with all such further and better particulars as are
          within the power of the applicant to supply.

provisions.title: Section 7
provisions.content:
7. The register shall, in respect of each specified article, come into
          force on a date five months after the date upon which any such article
          has been declared by the Minister to be a specified article and as from
          the date on which the register comes into force every producer of such
          article shall be required to be registered as a producer thereof.

provisions.title: Section 8
provisions.content:
8. Whehever the Registrar is satisfied that a person has by death or by
          reason of his ceasing to possess any interest in the lands on which a
          specified article is produced ceased to be a producer of a specified article
          he shall cause such person’s name to be deleted from the register.

provisions.title: Section 9
provisions.content:
9. Where a registered producer has by declaration satisfied the Regis-
          trar that he has for the past two years ceased to produce the article in
          respect of which he is registered, then the Registrar shall delete the name
          of such registered producer from the register in respect of such article.

provisions.title: Section 10
provisions.content:
10. Every person who acquires, whether by purchase, transmission,
          descent or by any other means whatsoever, any interest in land in respect
          of which his immediate predecessor in title was a registered producer
          shall within two months of the date on which he acquired such interest
Form 3.   make application to the Registrar in the form set forth as Form 3 in the
          Schedule to be registered as a producer in place of his predecessor in
          title and the Registrar shall on being satisfied of the change in the in-
          terest in the land amend the register accordingly.

provisions.title: Section 11
provisions.content:
11. Whenever the Registrar is satisfied that anything in the register
          relating to any registered producer or to any of the matters referred to in
          paragraph (c) of subsection 2 of section 4 of the Act is incorrectly stated
          therein, he may rectify such entry in the register.

provisions.title: Section 12
provisions.content:
12. No one shall be entitled to inspect or to search the register except
          by permission of the Registrar, which permission shall be in the dis-
          cretion of the Registrar to grant or to withhold.

provisions.title: Section 13
provisions.content:
13. Any person who contravenes or fails to comply with any of the
          provisions of these Regulations shall be guilty of an offence against these
          Regulations and shall be liable on summary conviction before a Resident
          Magistrate to a fine not exceeding fifty dollars or to imprisonment with
          hard labour for any term not exceeding three months.
